availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
19
The Governor approved an account of $965.64/100 to S. I. M. Major & Co. for printing done by order of the Executive Department for the year 1860.
He pardoned Christian Shroeder convicted of felony by the Jefferson Circuit Court and Sentenced to two years confinement in the Penitentiary
He appointed A. S Hamlin Comr of Deeds for the State of Missouri (St Joseph)
He remitted the following judgments, to wit:

row.cell: Louisville City Ct. vs. Wm McKaye

body.p: He remitted a Judgment of $50. & six months imprisonment of the Kenton Circuit Court against Ferdinand Hock for Cutting in an affray.
